metadata.title: CVE-2021-20181 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A race condition flaw was found in the 9pfs server implementation of QEMU up to and including 5.2.0. This flaw allows a malicious 9p client to cause a use-after-free error, potentially escalating their privileges on the system. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity as well as system availability.

criterions.comment: qemu package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:5.2+dfsg-6ubuntu2').
